data.text: @OrinKerr it's important to mention that the USA has 10 times the number of deaths per number of cases than any similarly developed country. 10 times. let that sink in.

@OrinKerr At this rate we will reach 1M US deaths March 19th.
In the US, 989,992 people have already died. 
New US deaths between 1200-1300 every day.

Even with available vaccines and some treatments. Unfortunately, the spread of this disease remains exponential.
https://t.co/U3rbHaPjQP

@JasonRylander @OrinKerr Yes, I was discussing a few weeks before the March 13 lockdowns with my husband that perhaps the only thing that could bridge partisan divides in this country was a common enemy like a public health crisis. I was so wrong…
@OrinKerr If you had told me then than an entire political party would organize against reasonable public health measures - that I would not have believed.
@JohnQBarrett @OrinKerr So much of the problem at THIS point is entirely down to vaccines and not being in people’s arms.  Its a recipe for nihilism in this country.

@OrinKerr Who in positions of power did not understand that this was well possible, and that not acting seriously for public health above all else could bring this about?  I estimate almost no one.  Yet here we are, because too many could not, and still won’t, make those decisions.

@OrinKerr @dandrezner considering what we were being told at this point in 2020, I think you would have been called a covid denialist or some other derogatory name if you said this is what was going to happen
@OrinKerr I kind of did know. That's why I take lock down, masking, and vaccinating very seriously. But what was I supposed to do about it? I can't get elected officials to understand.

@DL_138 @OrinKerr True enough. Maybe in retrospect, a blessing there was a focus on solution rather than finger pointing. But no investigations into the removal of the early warning office and other failures to plan or react is a stark contrast.

@glittercacophny @OrinKerr Not so much tired, but complaining that it was actively detrimental to their personal liberty...

Blows my tiny mind
